moves.1. d4 e6 2. Bf4 h6 3. Nf3 d6 4. Nbd2 Nf6: The exceptionally close black's position makes it difficult to attack.
moves.8. Nh4: No fearing g5, of course, after Qh5+, Ng6+, etc.
moves.8... O-O 9. Ng6 Rf7 10. Qh5: A free outpost, but... how to use it??
Black succeeded in blocking my lsb's action, because I played carelessly.
moves.13... Ndf6: Now my queen gets in troubles.
moves.14. Nxe7+ Qxe7 15. Qg6: I feel sorry for my queen... I have to throw it into the attack, since Bc4 doesn't work right now.
moves.15... Kh8 16. g4: Oh, my, so desperate was I to attack, that I forgot about the queen's escape square!
moves.16... Be6: but my opponent didn't see it either: Nf8 and the queen is lost!
moves.17. Bc4 c6 18. Bxe6 Qxe6: Trying to keep him busy and see if I can get my queen out of this!
moves.19. g5 Nxg5: It works. Still, Nf8 won the queen, but I just distracted him to realize it!
moves.21... Nh7 22. Qh4 g5 23. Qg3 Qxa2: Ok, now it's my turn to grab the advantage.
moves.24. h4: Qa1+, Nb1, and end of the story. in the meanwhile, I will build a nasty attack.
moves.24... gxh4: Black sees it, and keep the queen near to the action. Good for him.
moves.25... Rg8 26. Qh2 Rgg7: Ok, so, what is black's weakness?
moves.27. Rh1 Qa6 28. Qh3: This is. Or, better, c8 and the back rank is the weakness. And it will be exploited by Qc8, after RxN. It should work for a win.
moves.28... b5: Black has seen it, and covered the dangerous c8 square.
moves.30. Qh4: Renewing the threat on the back rank.
moves.30... Qb6: Black has seen it, is all too obvious.
moves.31. Qh3 Qc7 32. Nf3: Well, let's see if the knight can help...
moves.32... a5 33. Qh4: ?? Just a blunder. Qh5 was the move after which I could have considered the game won.
moves.34... Rxf6 35. Qxf6 a4: Thank you, black, now I have a chance.
moves.36. Qf8+ Rg8 37. Qf6+ Rg7 38. Qf8+ Rg8 3: Of course, a draw would be fine, but black won't lose the chance, even at the cost of some pawns.
moves.39... Qg7 40. Qxd6 c4 41. Qc5: I expected Qg2, so I covered f2 with the queen.
moves.41... Rf8 42. Qxb5: I decided the exchange would benefit me.
moves.44. bxa3: Ok, disrupts the pawn's chain, but... can he use the b column?
moves.46. Qc7: The most poisonous position for my queen. I ask myself why I am still alive.
moves.47... Qg2 48. Qh6: I planned Rg1, here, but I seeked for another threat. If Rf2, I'm fried.
moves.48... Rb8+ 49. Kc1 Qxe4: Black made a good thinking: now that the rook is away from f8, the queen can grab the pawn. Wrong. Poor black didn't expect that the knight will be his grave.
moves.50. Qf6+ Kg8 51. Rg1+: And it's mate in two. Thank you for reading.

gameName: Lost opportunities and mate out of nowhere.
